page.title: 12COUNCIL ELECTION-POLLING DAY
page.content: ON MAY 2nd.,1985, HALE SCHOOL WAS USED AS A POLLING STATION AND THE CHILDREN TOOK THE OPPORTUNITY TO INTERVIEW THE VOTERS. 105 PEOPLE WERE INTERVIEWED, 63 LADIES AND 42 MEN. 68 OF THESE CAME BY CAR TO THE POLLING STATION, 33 WALKED, 2 CYCLED AND 2 CAME BY MOTOR BIKE. MOST POPULAR HOBBIES OF VOTERS INTERVIEWED ARE :_ Ist.GARDENING, 2nd. WALKING, FOLLOWED BY FLOWER_ARRANGING, GOLF, MUSIC AND NEEDLEWORK. ABOUT HALF THE VOTERS BELONG TO AT LEAST ONE CLUB, THE MOST POPULAR BEING THE HORTICULTURAL SOCIETY, SOCIAL CLUB AND WOMEN'S INSTITUTE. THE VOTERS WERE ASKED IF THEY WOULD LIKE TO SEE ANY CHANGES IN THE VILLAGE. 59 PEOPLE SAID THEY WANTED NO CHANGE, BUT 21 WANT A POST OFFICE, 21 WANT A PUB AND 9 WANT A SHOP.7 WANT TO HAVE MORE SOCIAL ACTIVITIES IN HALE.
